Text.Value: He healed right in front of me, and chased us into the shadows. We took shelter here, and were considering a full retreat - until you came along.
Whatever he's done to protect himself is a magic so dark I can hardly fathom it.
Thank you - now I must make my way to the Towers.
*There's an acute sadness in her voice. It seems she's even more invested in this story than she'd like to admit.*
You can walk among the cult unnoticed. You can get close to Ketheric. Sounds to me like you're the answer to our biggest problem.
Why you? It's like the gods custom-designed you to sabotage this cult - to put an end to Ketheric Thorm.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) read was too dramatic too fangirly, doesnt match with following line

Text.Value: I can understand why he'd want me dead. Without me keeping the curse at bay, everyone in this inn - everyone intent on killing him - is dead too.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

Text.Value: Once I take Ketheric's head, you'll be safe again.
Brave fellow. They say there's no fanaticism like that of a convert, and Ketheric is a convert many times over.
I am. We all are.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little defensive.

Text.Value: To turn away from Selûne for this. This curse. This disgusting power to corrupt and kill...

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) read was on the verge of tears, try for more disgust as to what her father has done

Text.Value: Why target you?
I'm getting tired of hearing that.
I still don't see why it has to be me.
But now... he's returned. And he's invincible. Neither arrow nor sword can harm him.
A Moonlantern? Those are powered by trapped pixies, you know.
Ketheric is a frightening man. But you have something he doesn't: allies worth having.
Why me?
I'm not sure if I can trust a Selûnite.
As for why he'd want to take me alive... I don't know. And I don't want to find out.

EditorData.NodeContext: (gregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all was too casual

Text.Value: Now more than ever, you're our best hope of making it out of here alive.
This man - a Selûnite, not unlike myself - had family. Friends. And he abandoned them all to become a monster.
I'm getting tired of hearing that.
You seem afraid.
I've seen him in a kind of vision.
Marcus has been with us since the start - they've been tracking us this whole time.
I'm Isobel. And you're... meant to save us all, I believe?

EditorData.NodeContext: Dry humour.

Text.Value: You're the key to all of this.
We need you to infiltrate Moonrise Towers - no one will suspect a 'True Soul'. Ketheric's been made immortal.

EditorData.NodeContext: Referring to the player

Text.Value: Him presiding over a court of law. What a joke. I'm glad you got out of there alive - that's more than many can say.
Am I?
Marcus told me Ketheric wanted you captured - not killed. Why?
It was exactly as you reported. I can't believe I didn't see it sooner.
I'm fine.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reassuring - Isobel's survival means the survival of the entire region, so she's saying 'I'm all good, let's worry about more important things'

Text.Value: He began worshipping Shar and raised an army of Dark Justiciars right underneath the locals' noses. A coalition of Harpers and druids put him down - killed him and buried him in the Thorm family mausoleum.

EditorData.AnimationTags: *REUSE* [Isobel] casts magic exists in HAV_TakingIsobel_BriefInRoom, no name created yet <Greg>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
|Casts 'Protection from Good and Evil', but modified with Selunite (moon) magic to protect against the Shadowcurse specifically. Isobel can use the planned animations for this spell cinematically, or something bespoke as best fits the scene.

We see every party member  take on a moon-like effect as a result of being targeted with the spell, which then fades as though absorbed by each of them. This gives them a special in-game status to protect them from the curse|

Text.Value: Deeply corrupted.
But now that we have you, perhaps we have a chance.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

Text.Value: We're in more danger than I knew. If something happens to me, everyone in this inn is dead. Like that.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Snaps her finger on 'that' or does some other gesture of immediacy
EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) too breathless and hopeless, more grim realization

Text.Value: He is fickle. Changeable. His devotion is shallow but violent.
Selûne gave me the power to protect this place, but I can't keep it up forever. Such magic, it's... draining. Soon I'll be dry.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

Text.Value: She's right.
Everything Ketheric has touched for a hundred years has died - quickly, by violence, or slowly, by decay.
I never get tired of hearing that.
He can be unmade, but we need you to find out the source of his invulnerability.
I won't let that happen.
Anything else I should know before heading off?
Make him mortal, so we can make him bleed.
I know Jaheira narrowly escaped his grasp. Have you encountered him yet?
He used to preside over this village - a good man, a respected man - who turned to darkness quite suddenly, I've been told.
Our fates are entwined - more than you may realise. Ketheric's cult put that parasite in your head. There's no obscenity too vile for him.
An unfortunate coincidence. I hope never to meet the wicked man who haemorrhaged shadows over this peaceful village. But you - you're different.
Selûnite magic. Dark Lady forgive me.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This node if SH has been revealed as a shar worshipper
EditorData.NodeContext: Low-key revulsion

Text.Value: You were right. You tried to warn me, but I was too stubborn to listen. It won't happen again.

EditorData.logicalname: PLAYER WARNED JAH BUT NOT BELIEVED

Text.Value: I'd say the same about you, if I hadn't just seen you fight against Marcus. I'm willing to put my doubts aside - perhaps you can, too.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) tone it down a bit, starts off a little valley girl

Text.Value: Then I'd better be going.
Well! If I'd have realised, I'd have spared the theatrics. In that case, you should be able to navigate a path straight to your target. That's good - very good.

EditorData.logicalname: Isobel didn't give us the moonlantern

Text.Value: General Ketheric Thorm. Remember that name. He's the leader of the Absolutists.
It won't be enough to protect you against areas of utter darkness, though - where the curse is strongest. This lantern should, though.

EditorData.AnimationTags: REUSE [Isobel] Giving the moon lantern + player receiving moon lantern animations (No names yet) from theHAV_TakingIsobel_BriefInRoom dialog
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Isobel hands the player the Moon Lantern.

Text.Value: Small inn. And it's not every day someone like you comes waltzing out of the dark.
Let's hope your cunning is as strong as your optimism.
We need a champion to find the source of his invincibility and put it to an end. And it seems, my not-quite-True-Soul, that champion is you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sincere

Text.Value: Wait - before you head off into the shadows, there's... something else.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) Too nervous and tentative. The wait sounds like shes panicked.

Text.Value: And that was no random attack - you were the target, Isobel. They know how important you are.
I never get tired of hearing that.
Then you'd better find a way to stop a second attack.
Without me, Harpers, Flaming Fist, everyone intent on stopping Ketheric is dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all needs more determination

Text.Value: *Ketheric Thorm worshipped Lady Shar...? That would make him your natural ally, surely. Though perhaps it would be unwise to voice such a thought to present company...*
You are that chance. Protected by your artefact, you can infiltrate Moonrise Towers, posing as a True Soul.
Intriguing. Powerful.
Why does a man like him do anything? Power - spite - some kind of twisted, personal morality.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all
EditorData.NodeContext: She's talking about her father here, though not admitting htat to the player. This is deeply personal to her.

Text.Value: I've seen him - he was presiding over a trial. Survived what should've been a lethal blow, too.
How did you hear that?
For as long as I'm able. Even Selûne's light can't hold back the dark forever.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) more determination

Text.Value: Long dead - whoever she was.

EditorData.NodeContext: Betraying little emotion.

Text.Value: I'll look after them, Jaheira. You should check on the others.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Use construction animation or can be covered by the VO mocap
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: After this, Jaheira nods at Isobel, then looks at the player meaningfully

Text.Value: Marcus told me Ketheric wanted you captured - not killed. Why?
Only a fool would doubt the Moonmaiden.

EditorData.NodeContext: Pointed. Directed at Shadowheart for making an anti-Selune statement.

Text.Value: He was a Sharran, once - took to building an army of Dark Justiciars beneath this very village. Alongside the local druids, we made it our business to see him deposed - dead and buried.
Who's the woman in the picture?
If you are who I think you are, you have a long road ahead of you. Good luck. And thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Jaheira to player

Text.Value: But they don't know about you.
You'll be here to protect these people, won't you?
Consider it a backup in case you lose that lantern.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) too relaxed

Text.Value: I don't fear much. Not even death. But I do fear him.
*Her breath catches; you notice a barely-perceptible shudder run through her body.*
Pull the right brick, and the whole tower goes tumbling down.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

Text.Value: I haven't agreed to do anything.
Somehow fate keeps leading me to the same conclusion.
Discover the source of his invulnerability. Make him mortal, so we can make him bleed. Good luck.

EditorData.NodeContext: directed to player

Text.Value: Isobel. Isobel Thorm?
A gaudy display. Let's just hope it actually protects us.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This node if SH has NOT been revealed as a shar worshipper
EditorData.NodeContext: Distaste (while keeping her cards to her chest re: her shar worship)
EditorData.logicalname: SH INCLUSION - NOT KNOWN AS SHARRAN

Text.Value: I don't know why he's waiting, why he's not marching his army west as we speak, but as long as he remains, there's still a chance.
You'll have time for irrelevance when you're dead. For now, we need you.
The True Soul who saved my life - and a Sharran, if my senses don't deceive me.
The True Soul who saved my life.
So powerful he may be past our ability to fix this.
It suits you. And better than that, it'll make you immune to the lesser effects of the shadow curse, which will get you closer to the Towers.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) read was too jokey. The magic she uses prior to this is very elegant, almost spiritual

Text.Value: A man does not return from the dead and becomes impervious to arrows out of nowhere. There is magic at work - strong, arcane, and most likely necromantic.
Ketheric will strike again. We need you to strike first.
I haven't met him yet - but I intend to.
*Isobel. The same name as Ketheric Thorm's daughter - the one whose sarcophagus you found empty in the family mausoleum.*
Well! Now you have two. Just in case.

EditorData.logicalname: Isobel did give us the moonlantern

Text.Value: Perhaps there's something to it, then.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) next line is "No mercy." pretty odd tone shift

Text.Value: You did? How did he... how did he seem?
There is, actually.
Not yet. Jaheira says he's invincible - that I need to find a way to make him vulnerable.
I have. You.
I found this on the wall when I arrived. It must be a hundred years old. Ketheric, before he turned.

EditorData.AnimationTags: *REUSE* animation of Isobel showing the photograph from HAV_TakingIsobel_BriefInRoom (No name yet)
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
She shows us an old daguerrotype photo of two individuals: Ketheric Thorm and Aylin (Nightsong). They stand side-by-side in a somewhat austere way, rather than affectionate. Still, each has kindness in their face. Isobel was the (magical) 
photographer.

Text.Value: Good. Because your work here is only beginning.
You can walk among the cult unnoticed - which means you can get close to their leader, Ketheric Thorm, in Moonrise Towers.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) was too reverant in awe of the player

Text.Value: I already have a Moonlantern. I can safely travel the shadows.
Isobel - this is -
A Sharran? Perhaps someone I should seek out...

EditorData.NodeContext: Intrigued

Text.Value: The darkness he's subscribed to is unlike any I've heard of. I fear there's something deeper behind it all - something neither you, nor I, nor even Selûne can fix.
We've met. She warned me about Marcus - just before the attack.
We've met. He warned me about Marcus - just before the attack.
We've met. They warned me about Marcus - just before the attack.

EditorData.NodeContext: Referring to the player

Text.Value: I might take that badly if you hadn't just saved my neck, Sharran.

EditorData.NodeContext: Mock civility

Text.Value: Isobel! Are you all right?

EditorData.NodeContext: Relieved. If Isobel had been taken, things would be very bad

Text.Value: I have something for you - something that'll help you make it to the Towers.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) too relaxed, she is equipping the player before sending them off to almost certain death

Text.Value: You can walk among the cultists undetected; you can find the source of Ketheric's power.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) too reverant and in awe of the player doesnt match with previous

Text.Value: We met him on the road here - commanding the army of the Absolute. I put an arrow through his eye myself, only to watch him pluck it out like a splinter.
We'll be sure to free them - after Ketheric is dead.
I don't like to go on in front of the others, but... it's about Ketheric Thorm.

EditorData.NodeContext: Lowering voice

Text.Value: Who is Ketheric?
Now that we have you, I hope I won't have to.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) rerecord as part of a thread to ensure tone across all

Text.Value: Remember what we discussed. Ketheric will strike again. We need you to strike first.

EditorData.NodeContext: She needs in affirmation, but has one last thing to say to the players before departing.

Text.Value: I've been over this with Jaheira. I'll head to the Towers shortly.
But he's returned. Not only does General Ketheric Thorm live again, it seems he is no longer mortal. He has become, in fact, invincible.
Your future is our future. Stop Ketheric, and you may find the cure to that parasite in your head.
No mercy. For Ketheric will have none on you. End this.

EditorData.NodeContext: (GregRetake) line is preceded by several lines, first record had a major shift in tone. Treat "no mercy" as advice not a command.

Synopsis: Jaheira and Isobel (and the player) reunite after the fight with Marcus. Jaheira is relieved Isobel hasn't been captured. Isobel debriefs with player and sends them off on their main mission for Act 2. Both of them will be in heightened mood, having just survived a fierce battle- not totally out of breath, but still recovering from the immediate battle.
